hits.title: Democracy Index
hits.subtitle: Data by the Economist Intelligence Unit. Expert estimates of the extent to which citizens can choose their political leaders in free and fair elections, enjoy civil liberties, prefer democracy over other political systems, can and do participate in politics, and have a functioning government that acts on their behalf. The index ranges from 0 to 10 (most democratic).
availableEntities: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

Expert estimates of the extent to which citizens can choose their political leaders in free and fair elections, enjoy civil liberties, prefer democracy over other political systems, can and do participate in politics, and have a functioning government that acts on their behalf. The index ranges from 0 to 10 (most democratic).

hits.title: Agricultural value added per worker
hits.subtitle: Agricultural value added per worker is calculated by dividing the amount of economic value generated from farming, forestry and fishing by the number of people that work in these sectors. This data is expressed in US dollars. It is adjusted for inflation but does not account for differences in living costs between countries.
availableEntities: Middle East, North Africa, Afghanistan and Pakistan (WB)

subtitle.value: Agricultural value added per worker is calculated by dividing the amount of economic value generated from farming, forestry and fishing by the number of …

Agricultural value added per worker is calculated by dividing the amount of economic value generated from farming, forestry and fishing by the number of people that work in these sectors. This data is expressed in US dollars. It is adjusted for inflation but does not account for differences in living costs between countries.

hits.title: Consumption-based CO₂ emissions per capita vs. GDP per capita
hits.subtitle: Consumption-based emissions are measured in tonnes per person. They are territorial emissions minus emissions embedded in exports, plus emissions embedded in imports. GDP per capita is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.

hits.title: Land area in square kilometres
hits.subtitle: Total land area, measured in square kilometres (km²). Land area is a country's total area, excluding area under inland water bodies, national claims to continental shelf, and exclusive economic zones. In most cases the definition of inland water bodies includes major rivers and lakes.
availableEntities: Middle East, North Africa, Afghanistan and Pakistan (WB)
